page.title: 17Tickhill Corn Mill B
page.content: {Lord Scarbrough,}the owner,wanted permission to make the mill a private home.The council held over for 12 mths in 1980/81.A 3 man team,set on by the council,looked at cost,conservation and maintenance.A 300 house{survey}set in Tickhill had these results.Do you want the mill to remain?{93%}said yes. How do you wish to see the mill used? Rural Industry{13%}Craft Workshop{22% Private Residence{8%}Shop{3%}Local Museum{19%}Working Mill{30%}Community Meeting Place{5%.}To keep it a working mill are you prepared to have a rate increase?Only{50%}said yes.Planning for a Mill Craft Shop was required. Consent was given.In{1982}the mill was put up for sale.Interest was shown by entrepreneurs but as yet the mill remains unsold and boarded up.
